text: The Modern South Arabian, or Eastern South Semitic, languages are a branch of Semitic languages. They are spoken by a small number of people in Southern Arabia in the countries of Yemen and Oman, as well as Socotra Island.Simeone- Senelle, Marie-Claude (1997). The Modern South Arabian Languages . In Hetzron, R. (ed.). 1997. The Semitic Languages. London: Routledge, p. 378-423.Rendsburg, Gary A. Modern South Arabian as a source for Ugaritic etymologies . ==References== Category:Semitic languages
title: Modern South Arabian languages
